reference: A. Blinder and Y. Weiss, Human Capital and Labor Supply: A Synthesis, Forthcoming, Journal of Political Economy, July 1976.
C. Brown, A Model of Optimal Human Capital Accumulation and the Wages of Young High School Graduates, Journal of Political Economy, Vol. 84 (April 1976) pp. 299-316.
W. Haley, Human Capital: The Choice Between Investment and Income, American Economic Review, 1973.
J. Heckinan, A Life Cycle Model of Earnings, Learning, and Consumption, Journal of Political Economy, mimeo 1975.
G. Johnson and F. Stafford, Lifetime Earnings in a Professional Labor Market: Academic Economists, Journal of Political Economy, 82 (May/June 1974), pp. 549-570.
T. Johnson, Returns from Investment in Human Capital, American Economic Review, 1970.
L. Lillard, Human Capital Life Cycle Earnings Model: A Specific Solution and Estimation, National Bureau of Economic Research, Working Paper 4, 1973.
J. Mincer, On-the Job Training: Costs, Returns, and Some Implications, Journal of Political Economy, Supplement, LXX (October 1962), pp. 50-79.
J. Mincer and S. Polachek, Family Investment in Human Capital Earnings of Women, in T.W. Schultz, Ed., Economics of the Family, National Bureau of Economic Research, 1974.
S. Rosen, Learning and Experience in the Labor Ilarket, Journal of Human Resources, 7 (Summer 1972), pp. 326-342.
Ruggles, Nancy D. and Richard, An Anatomy of Earnings Behavior, a paper presented at the Conference on Research in Income and Wealth, May 1974.
T. D. Wallace and L. A. Ihnen, Full Time Schooling in Life Cycle Models of Human Capital Accumulation, Journal of Political Economy, Vol. 81 (February 1975) pp. 137-156.
Y. Weiss, Notes on Income-Generating Functions, Princeton University, 1974.
